intro: Trichophorum distigmaticum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sedge, is a flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. The plant has slender, triangular stems and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in spike-like clusters. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a slightly hairy surface. Trichophorum distigmaticum plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
